It was the fifteenth day of the fourth month of the year Gengchen.
These are auspicious dates.
They're definitely recorded without difference.
Suppose we take the buddha teacher Sajava.
The date of his birth was mentioned by the buddha Sajava master.
It was the eighth day of the twilight of the year Dingmao.
Suppose we take the great teacher Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra's teaching that he was born in the year Kālôdayin.
He said that he was born in the year Kawu.
If he relies on the master Kache Ban Chan.
and the two masters who dropped out of Puṇyatana.
They said it was the day of his descent and return.

The meaning of what those wise men taught was profound and immeasurable.
They're profound and difficult to fathom.

What I've explained is the same as that which's always practiced.
They're the same as those who practice constantly.

source_sentence: 又見雜阿含經及涅槃等經。
translation: See also the various Āgamas and Nirvana sūtras.

source_sentence: 所說佛現神變日(二月二日)得證菩提日。
translation: They say that the Buddha's miraculous day (the second day of the second month) is the day he attains enlightenment.
It's the day he first turned the wheel of the Dharma.
It's the day he first turns the wheel of the Dharma and the day he goes back down.
These are the four most auspicious days.
Anyone who does good deeds will be ten billion times better off than on ordinary days.
They're ten billion times better than ordinary days.

source_sentence: 功德無量矣(二修習法載于本經)。
translation: Their merits are incalculable. (The two cultivation methods are listed in this sūtra.)
After the ceremony for the cultivation of the Master of Medicine's rituals and the method for laying out the altar...
